ingredients: Whole spices (4 cloves, 4 cardamoms, 1-inch cinnamon, 1 bay leaf)
3 tbsp refined oil or coconut oil

steps.title: Soak Jeerakasala Rice
steps.description: Rinse the jeerakasala rice 2–3 times until the water runs clear. Soak it in water for 30 minutes.

steps.title: Fry Onions for Garnishing
steps.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add thinly sliced onions and shallow-fry on medium heat until golden brown. Remove and drain on paper towels.

steps.title: Sauté Cashews and Raisins
steps.description: In the same or a separate pan, heat ghee and sauté cashews until golden. Add raisins and sauté until they puff up. Set aside for garnishing.

steps.title: Marinate Chicken Lightly
steps.description: In a bowl, mix chicken with a little salt and turmeric. Let it sit for about 10 minutes.

steps.title: Sear the Chicken
steps.description: Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed pan. Add the marinated chicken and sear on high heat until the outside is lightly browned.

steps.title: Add Aromatics and Tomatoes
steps.description: Lower the heat and add ginger-garlic paste. Sauté until raw smell disappears. Add green chilies and chopped tomatoes. Cook until tomatoes soften.

steps.title: Add Spices and Yogurt
steps.description: Mix in red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Stir well. Add yogurt and cook until the masala thickens and coats the chicken.

steps.title: Simmer Chicken Until Cooked
steps.description: Cover the pan and cook the chicken on low heat until tender and fully cooked. Stir occasionally to prevent burning.

steps.title: Boil Water with Whole Spices
steps.description: In a separate large vessel, bring ample water to a boil. Add whole spices, salt, and a few drops of oil.

steps.title: Cook the Rice
steps.description: Add the soaked rice to the boiling water. Cook until 90% done – the grains should be soft but still firm in the center. Drain and set aside.

steps.title: Layer Chicken and Rice
steps.description: In a deep pot, spread the cooked chicken masala at the bottom. Layer half of the cooked rice on top.

steps.title: Add Herbs and Garnishes
steps.description: Sprinkle half of the chopped mint, coriander, fried onions, and lemon juice over the rice layer.

steps.title: Repeat Layering
steps.description: Add the remaining rice as the second layer. Top with the rest of the mint, coriander, and fried onions.

steps.title: Seal and Dum Cook
steps.description: Cover the pot with a tight lid or seal with dough. Place over very low heat and cook for 15–20 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.

steps.title: Rest Before Serving
steps.description: Let the biryani rest for 10 minutes after dum. This helps settle the layers and enhance flavor.

steps.title: Garnish and Serve
steps.description: Gently fluff the top rice with a fork. Garnish with fried cashews and raisins before serving.
